results.title: Donald's better self
results.creator_credit: Jack King, Walt Disney and Walt Disney Animation Studios
results.brief_description: Donald Duck has two sides to his character. On the one hand, his good self strives to do the right thing, but his bad self usually wins. Donald sleeps late in the morning, and it takes his better self to make him dress and start off the school. On the way to school his bad self entices him to play truant.

results.title: Donald
results.brief_description: Released to celebrate 50 years in show business, this video presents a selection of Donald’s finest moments. Individual titles include: “Donald’s cousin Gus”, “The Riveter”, “The Autograph hound”, “A Good time for a dime”, “Donald’s tire trouble”, “Drip dippy Donald” and “The New neighbour”. The compilation is introduced by rare film footage of Walt Disney. No other production details available.

results.title: Don Quixote: Kitri's wedding
results.brief_description: The American Ballet Theatre’s production of Don Quixote: Kitri’s Wedding at the Metropolitan Opera House in New York. Stars Mikhail Baryshnikov and Cynthia Harvey with choreography by Baryshnikov.

results.title: Don Quixote in the tales of La Mancha
results.brief_description: Two adventures featuring Don Quixote: DON QUIXOTE AND THE FAMILY TREASURES: Don Quixote falls in love with Fidora, thinking she’s his dream princess Dulsonia, but Fidora is not motivated by love, she’s after the Quixote family fortune. Meanwhile with help from Sancho, Don Quixote protects Fidora from the infamous Black night: DON QUIXOTE MEETS THE WITCH QUEEN: Don’s Quixote’s ploy of stealing the witch queen’s magic diamond to give to his dream princess backfires when the diamond is broken and witch queen Marlena wants Don Quixote to marry her. No other production details available.

results.title: Don Quixote [Nureyev]
results.creator_credit: Robert Helpmann, Rudolf Nureyev, John L. Hargreaves and International Arts
results.brief_description: Robert Helpmann plays the principle role of Don Quixote in this production which features the Australian Ballet and music by the State Orchestra of Victoria. Cast includes Ray Powell, Francis Croese and Colin Peasley. Also features a documentary on the making of the film, ‘A Little bit of Don Quixote’.

results.title: Don Quixote
results.brief_description: Outlandishly loopy cartoon from this pioneering american animator. Quixote’s world is transfigured by his own unchecked imagination - he navigates an enchanted vista of fairy-tale cliches. Whimsical questing for gallant ideals ends in fevered retreat to the sanctuary of Ye Olde Bughouse. Disarmingly innocent and frenetically paced, this is among Iwerk’s best works.

results.title: Don Pasquale
results.creator_credit: Basil Coleman, Terry deLacey and HTV Cymru Wales
results.brief_description: This made for television production of the comic opera “Don Pasquale” by Gaettano Donizetti features The Welsh Philharmonia led by John Stein and conducted by Richard Armstrong and The Welsh National Opera Chorale led by associate conductor Anthony Hose with music direction by Norman Kay. It tells the tale of Don Pasquale (Geraint Evans), an elderly and wealthy bachelor who is desperate to marry, whilst however, his nephew and sole heir, Ernesto (Ryland Davies), refuses to marry the woman assigned to him by Pasquale because Ernesto is in love with another woman, Norina (Lillian Watson). As a result, Pasquale disowns Ernesto. With the help of Ernesto’s friend, Dottora Malatesta (Russell Smythe), an elaborate scheme is prepared in which Norina marries Don Pasquale and drives him so crazy as to allow her to marry Ernesto instead. Delightful costuming and set designs in beautiful pastel colors along with the magical voices of the lead singers, make this entertaining and light-hearted production a must for lovers of opera. Sung in Italian with English subtitles.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Basil Coleman, Terry deLacey and HTV Cymru Wales

results.title: Don Juan de Marco
results.creator_credit: Jeremy Leven, Patrick Palmer, Fred Fuchs, Francis Ford Coppola and New Line Cinema
results.brief_description: Just ten days shy of his retirement, psychotherapist Jack Mickler (Marlon Brando) is brought in by the authorities to help ‘talk down’ a suicidal man (Johnny Depp), devastated by the loss of his lover. Clothed in a cape and mask the heart broken man believes he is the legendary seducer of women, Don Juan De Marco. The doctor takes him on as a patient and through their therapy sessions Don Juan recounts his many romantic adventures and conquests. At first sceptical of the mans sanity, Dr. Mickler is gradually seduced by Don Juan’s outlandish tales of love, leading him to question the fictional nature of his stories and the man’s real identity. It’s not long before Mickler is applying Don Juan’s instructional lessons on his wife (Faye Dunaway). Jeremy Leven’s unashamed paean to romance is given unexpected depth and poignancy from the exceptional cast, starting with the ever charismatic Johnny Depp and the inspired coupling of Marlon Brando and Faye Dunaway. Their intimate husband and wife banter is one of the films highlights. Cast also includes Geraldine Pailhas, Bob Dishy, Rachel Ticotin, Talisa Soto and Selena Perez.

results.title: Don Juan = Don Juan 1973 ou Si Don Juan Etait Une Femme
results.brief_description: Roger Vadim directed Brigitte Bardot in her last feature film, as a female version of the legendary lover, Don Juan. Told in flashback, the narrative depicts Jeanne’s confession — to seducing an array of vulnerable men, several of whom meet with sticky ends. Partly a critique of sexual mores, this film plays as an intriguing timepiece of female sexuality and the corruptive urges of human nature. Cast also includes Jane Birkin as one of Jeanne’s lovers.
